name: Hand/Wrist Bandaging
description: Figure-8 bandaging technique for hand and wrist
warning: For hand and wrist injuries. Apply pressure first to control bleeding.

steps.title: Start at Wrist
steps.description: Make two straight turns at the wrist to anchor the bandage.
steps.voice_prompt: Start by making two straight anchor turns around the wrist.

steps.title: Roll Diagonally
steps.description: Roll the bandage diagonally from thumb to the pinky.
steps.voice_prompt: Roll the bandage diagonally from the thumb side to the pinky side.

steps.title: Bandage Across Fingers
steps.description: Bandage across the front of the fingers.
steps.voice_prompt: Wrap the bandage across the front of the fingers.

steps.title: Bandage Across Back
steps.description: Bandage across back of the hand.
steps.voice_prompt: Wrap the bandage across the back of the hand.

steps.title: Repeat Figure-8 Pattern
steps.description: Repeat turns 3 and 4 like drawing the number 8.
steps.voice_prompt: Repeat the figure-8 pattern several times to secure the bandage.
steps.critical_warning: The pattern should look like the number 8 when viewed from above

steps.title: Secure the Bandage
steps.description: Secure the bandage with a safety pin.
steps.voice_prompt: Secure the end of the bandage with a safety pin or tape.

steps.title: Check Circulation
steps.description: Check the fingertips for proper circulation. If fingers become cold, numb, or change color, loosen the bandage.
steps.voice_prompt: Check fingertip circulation. Loosen if fingers become cold or numb.
